document.title: COMPREHENSIVE HEALTH AND PHYSICAL EDUCATION Grades Pre-Kindergarten to 12

638A1373B7A04EB89B28F8E54E3DC020.description:
Identify behaviors, policies and practices in the school community that promote or hinder
dignity and respect for all individuals, including those of different sexual orientations, gender
identities, and gender expression. [HPE; SE]

88991BAE5C5F4AD0B55B88FCF81239A5.description:
Encourage others to refrain from teasing or bullying others based on their sexuality (e.g., sexual
activity [including abstinence], sexual orientation) or gender (e.g., gender expression, gender
identity). [HPE; SE]

EFF1C5997FA343C6845624AADAA441BC.description:
Demonstrate ways to show courtesy and respect for others when aspects of their sexuality (e.g.,
sexual activity [including abstinence], sexual orientation) or gender (e.g., gender expression,
gender identity) are different from one’s own. [HPE; SE]

8B6CD28362CB48AEB180E563A1F335CD.description:
Identify reasons that harassment is harmful and illegal along with warning signs for when to
report it and seek help from a safe/trusted adult or health professional. [HE]

02786660C52747A79C1D8A1E8495FCE1.description: Work cooperatively to support the safety of individuals, families, and communities. [HPE; SE]

A4726B76EC7C4318B54F39A1E7ACAE71.description:
Demonstrate how to influence and support others to make choices that maintain or enhance
personal safety. [HPE]

D86E65CB72A244A3A9CDF3E7B4F8B0AF.description:
State a position, supported by accurate information, that encourages peers to adopt or continue
practices that maintain or enhance personal safety. [HPE]

EE2F8515FE5F4DC2916D6825F18C2D4E.description:
Collaborate effectively to support nutrition-related practices or behaviors that maintain or
enhance health. [HPE]

C69ADDACB0C54039A3B5ECF316284796.description:
Identify personal dietary needs (e.g., dietary allergies, food preferences) and goals, and
advocate to address the identified needs and goals. [HPE]

0F1270C5A0794835968195DB25DBD298.description:
Articulate a health-promoting position on a nutrition-related topic and support the claim with
accurate information. [HPE]

29525BA5454F466D8F737B9ABE782E40.description:
Discuss a variety of perspectives on health-promoting eating practices (e.g., food guidelines
from other countries and cultures, USDA Guidelines and Harvard’s Healthy Eating plate, cultural
food practices, buying locally grown or produced foods) and describe the health benefits of and
strategies for implementing these practices. [HE]

53E18472E8FB463FB4777AB7D0BECB8E.description:
Analyze a variety of influences (e.g., media, peers, family, culture, stigmas, school, economics,
food access, food production and cultivation) on nutrition-related beliefs and behaviors, and
today’s society. [HE]

11E730340FA74D6F9B1E08E6EFAC2E29.description:
Demonstrate the importance of food to all people and how food is used to keep us healthy,
return us to health, and connect us (e.g., soup when you are ill, comfort food, food after major
events). [HE]

1B2DF6739D3D4231BE1B8C25BD50F7BB.description:
Evaluate strategies for opposing, reducing, or eliminating stereotyping, prejudice,
discrimination, and injustice. [HPE; SE]

7917E3E3514240EBAA933F0F53BA9398.description:
Utilize positive peer and societal norms when formulating a health-promoting position related
to eliminating discrimination, injustice, and challenge negative norms. [HPE; SE]

DFC0F0905755407480B0AD261AFAF876.description: Demonstrate strategies for reducing stigma related to mental health. [HPE; SE]

9A0F396928DA4380B5BF39DBFBE94DE5.description: Demonstrate strategies for supporting healthy body image in youth and adolescents. [HPE; SE]

6203EDE4DBBE497F966DFD9CC1C50435.description: Analyze the effects of social media on mental and emotional health. [HPE; SE]

96BA65507CB04515980EC0E1E48ADA6D.description:
Analyze influences on body image and the relationship between body image, disordered eating,
and mental health. [HPE; SE]

1CA0D80B3AAA494FB75F039BC2CFFC1B.description:
Analyze how stereotyping, bias, prejudice, and discrimination can impact mental and emotional
health. [HPE; SE]

1FC427043EBE4D5A96998640BEC03450.description:
Self-Advocacy and Health Promotion.
Promote personal, family, and community health and well-being.

8EC6C8EAF01C4DF79D450E2DD0BF76E2.description:
Identify parents, guardians, or other supportive and trusted adults to whom students can ask
questions about gender, gender-role stereotypes, gender identity, and sexual orientation and
demonstrate strategies for engaging in these conversations. [HE; SE]

9C1DDB76D71C455F964FA7100A4210F6.description:
Access credible sources of information about gender identity, gender expression, sexual
orientation, and healthy sexuality development. [HE]

9A17313648104222910E745E820AD203.description:
Access credible sources of information about human sexual and reproductive health (including
pregnancy and pregnancy options). [HE]

6987E1C02A0C44DF980D10B859B7B56C.description:
Analyze the validity of claims for health information, products, and services about human sexual
and reproductive health. [HE]

335B5608710F4173BF933EBBBF641EF8.description:
Locate community resources that provide support and resources related to sexual exploitation
or for getting help for self or others in situations related to sex trafficking. [HE]

3348E32FDAF24B31A7109B8DC45C7DE4.description:
Explain why a person who has been bullied, exploited, sexually harassed, sexually abused,
sexually assaulted, or has been a victim of incest, rape, domestic violence, dating violence, or
gender-based violence is not at fault. [HPE]

148BF41E00D944AC893DDCF2D20B54DA.description:
Identify sources of support such as parents or other trusted adults to whom students can go if
they or someone they know is being bullied, harassed, abused, assaulted, or exploited. [HPE; SE]

8EF1A8F25DFB4EF688CCA19D2A034510.description:
Locate a variety of personal health-related digital resources and assess each for reliability and
validity. [HPE]

A188638DF0EB42C3997B734329081D01.description:
Access personal health products (e.g., deodorant, hair care, menstrual products, sunscreen,
dental care products) based on individual needs, and evaluate the ease of accessibility and
use. [HPE]

37E3CD428C2D4CCD8D657C15DAC12DB7.description:
Locate valid and reliable information on puberty, personal hygiene, menstruation, and personal
health products from a variety of resources in one’s home, school, and community and evaluate
their validity. [HPE]

341A6217CDC94A7D88E838D303F34716.description:
Determine the accessibility of public, community, and environmental products, resources and
services that enhance health and identify supports or barriers to accessing the products or
services. [HPE]

B134993548FB485F959737A7E935CE06.description:
Locate valid and reliable products and services to enhance mental and emotional well-being,
manage stress and emotions, and treat mental health conditions. [HE]

32D9C122C30A406CA711533F379BE09A.description: Demonstrate the ability to access professional health services if needed. [HE; SE]

1343CBDA437345088C68FC6350F4BCF4.description:
Describe situations where professional health services are necessary to support or improve
mental and emotional well-being. [HE]

D5BAE0D5249245748B4CCE60232A5430.description:
Information and resource seeking.
Access, evaluate, and use valid and reliable health information, products, services, and
related resources.

1E5FCB5A7F044550BDD3CD53AB622ED1.description:
Analyze internal and external influences (e.g., personal values and beliefs, peers, media,
technology, family, society, community, culture, stigmas) that have an impact on an individual’s
sexual behaviors. [HE; SE]

AEE745906B8F4EC089DCF055D718AFAB.description:
Analyze external influences (e.g., peers, media, technology, family, society, community, culture,
cultural stigmas) that have an impact on an individual’s attitudes, beliefs, and expectations
about gender identity, gender roles, and sexual orientation. [HE; SE]

A0A25EC6DC5245A3B20A68CF136EAF0E.description:
Explain how perceptions, social norms, and social environment influence thoughts, attitudes,
beliefs, and behaviors toward sexual orientation, sexual health and sexual activity. [HE; SE]

5945B1A04A3644528E4CCE259F260486.description: Encourage others to improve health outcomes. [HPE]

351227D7A2FC4DB98EA36306EEF1C26A.description:
Analyze how environmental factors (e.g., air quality, trash and litter, availability of clean drinking
water) and types of pollution (e.g., air, noise, chemical, water) affect health. [HPE]

E7AED2E83E6A443381C72794414BF591.description:
Explain how public health policies and government regulations influence health promotion and
disease prevention in both positive and negative ways. [HE]

EBCAE810AAC14127B6E6CDE0C26556F1.description:
Analyze how stigma and public perception can influence access to health and health care (e.g.,
menstrual health care, mental health services and supports, preventative screenings). [HE]

228741428295442E843E0DF8F65A6872.description:
Analyze how a variety of social determinants of health (e.g., education, social environment,
socioeconomic conditions, food availability, public safety, discrimination) may impact health at
different levels (e.g., individual, family, and community). [HPE]

D428FC55DF6842AF9145FB34E03FDBED.description:
Analyze how sharing or posting personal information electronically about self or others (e.g.,
chat groups, email, texting, sexting, websites, social media, phone and tablet applications) can
impact the safety of self or others. [HE]

C7C01843AFF14FE5AAACD3408D356805.description:
Analyze laws related to sexual harassment, sexual abuse, sexual assault, and domestic violence
and how the laws impact individual safety. [HE]

222BF41E38214D6B8CFF0C7DA7FDA19D.description:
Analyze how various influences (e.g., peers, family, culture, society, school, and community
policies) impact the safety of adolescents in a varied of situations (including during physical
activity). [HPE]

D3521ED5689F49858E7CD060D39C451B.description:
Self-awareness and Analyzing Influences.
Examine how emotions, thoughts, needs, values, beliefs, and other factors (both internal
and external) influence behaviors and articulate how these influences impact health
behavior and outcomes.

0D15CC9E2D734DF989A239E6591B8F9A.description:
Demonstrate effective techniques related to developing muscular strength and endurance,
including appropriate and safe use of exercise machines, free weights, and bodyweight
exercises. [PE]

55CD77C5A17545E9987641EA14259920.description:
Demonstrate correct technique for basic skills in at least two self-selected outdoor sports or
physical activities (e.g., hiking, skateboarding, cross country or downhill skiing, snowshoeing,
kayaking/canoeing, parkour), individual performance activities, or indoor/dance activities (e.g.,
hip-hop/line/folk dance, swimming, gymnastics, wrestling, self-defense). [PE]

37F045CFC60E4F48808C0928E0606574.description:
Effectively combine and apply locomotor, stability/non-locomotor (e.g., weight transfer), and
manipulative skills in a variety of athletic and physical activities, and game play (including
net/wall games, target games, invasion games, fielding and striking games). [PE]

C2EC6016DF2F49FC9D833F49914B6700.description:
Demonstrate developmentally-appropriate manipulative skills (i.e., throwing and catching,
striking [with and without implements], volleying, serving [with hands and implements],
dribbling with hands and feet, and shooting) in a variety of practice tasks, small sides games and
other physical activities (including net/wall games, cooperative games, target games, invasion
games, fielding and striking games). [PE]

2408230EA67A43A7927DF67A21E1D214.description:
Demonstrate movement sequences within varied dance forms to music as an individual or in a
group. [PE]

0FCCCC47B102406C9939534BEAA2AC13.description:
Exhibit developmentally-appropriate command of locomotor and non-locomotor skills, rhythm,
and timing. [PE]

55DBCC99B530449D9DB32D407EDFC099.description:
Movement Skills.
Demonstrate competence in, and knowledge of, a variety of movement forms, motor
skills, physical fitness components, and principles in order to engage in purposeful and
health-promoting physical activity, including sports and games.

E01D71C0D8684DFF908295BCD64CB40E.description:
Demonstrate effective verbal and nonverbal communication skills (including refusal) to keep self
or others safe in substance use- and misuse-related situations (e.g., avoiding riding with a driver
who is under the influence, seeking help, leaving a situation) in order to protect individuals from
risk or injury. [HE]

3331767AAE534F2DB81E735AF223D7D0.description:
Summarize and communicate the effects of using legal (e.g., prescription drugs prescribed to
you, over-the-counter drugs, and [at a certain age] nicotine, electronic vapor products, alcohol
and marijuana) and illegal drugs (e.g., prescription drugs not prescribed to you, cocaine)
on brain development and multiple dimensions of health (e.g., physical, social, occupational,
mental/emotional). [HE]

8E63C3B74D3A4D15913AA86AB34D9B22.description:
Describe the ways that social characteristics (i.e., socioeconomic status, culture, gender) can
impact risk and protective factors for substance use and misuse. [HE]

4BC438F6211645C8AE7FC26FDFA9C540.description:
Analyze influences (e.g., culture, peers, media, perceptions of norms) that could lead to the use
of nicotine, electronic vapor products, alcohol, or other illegal (in regard to age, use, or type)
and potentially harmful substances. [HE]

EA1A7B03C9C14457BA076B35B26E5B9B.description:
Analyze social situations in multiple settings (e.g., at home, at school, out with friends, at a
party) that could lead to the use of nicotine, electronic vapor products, alcohol, or other illegal
(in regard to age, use, or type) and potentially harmful substances. [HE]

5CA639A40B5848F09A8D8725C30678B4.description:
Demonstrate the ability to create or maintain positive relationships with people of all gender
identities, gender expressions, and sexual orientations. [HPE; SE]

573EA8A63C7B43EA9E06383E17D8CE27.description:
Explain that attractions can be romantic, emotional, and/or sexual to an individual of the same
gender and/or a different gender(s) and that attractions can change over time. [HE]

659CD3ED7A4A4316B4968B976DF1F801.description:
Explain how assigned sex assigned at birth, gender identity, and gender expression are distinct
concepts and how they interact with each other. [HE]

EB52F810636E4C218C5D5EC1ED2FFCFB.description:
Explain three dimensions of sexual orientation (i.e., identity, attraction, and behavior) and how
they are all a part of an individual’s sexual orientation that may or may not align with each
other. [HE]

0FC8B782624E4AA2A51DDDCC54D23B32.description: Explain the difference between sexual orientation and gender identity. [HE]

A4B2B12E462440B880780230E925650A.description:
Collaboratively establish norms and guidelines for resolving conflicts and use those
rules/guidelines/agreements to resolve conflict or respond to participants’ ethical and unethical
behavior during physical activity. [PE; SE]

6DBE9E646E1240FEA6F6784485E3250D.description:
Provide constructive feedback to a peer, using teacher-generated guidelines, and incorporate
appropriate tone and other communication skills (e.g., eye-contact, body language). [HPE; SE]

56756FCB6E4041EABAB26AD05356DC24.description:
Exhibit responsible social behaviors by respectfully interacting with others, including and
cooperating with classmates, asking for help when needed for self and others, maintaining
positive relationships, and collaborating productively on problem-solving initiatives during
adventure activities, large-group initiatives, and/or game play. [HPE; SE]

9FA5CF781D4D4402A7C1207513451FB9.description: Use communication skills to negotiate strategies and tactics in a physical activity setting. [PE; SE]

AE7EDCF0A3C64AC78B7C3C87E23E8A32.description: Describe how social interaction impacts individual engagement in physical activity. [PE; SE]

3569A4C270D34EAA8C42B5D160FC5F89.description: Understand and accept others’ differences during a variety of physical activities. [PE]

8678C27EF08F4BAB9DF30067371E5748.description:
Effectively express needs, wants, emotions, and feelings (including affection, love, friendship,
concern, anger) in respectful and health-promoting ways. [HPE; SE]

A2E16C1C7CFC47BD8CA4E9DE564EC179.description:
Demonstrate how to respond (e.g., calling 9-8-8, telling a trusted adult) when there is a concern
about one’s own or someone else’s mental well-being or where someone is considering harming
or killing themselves. [HE; SE]

0C5352087C614BED887CA72490277618.description:
Identify signs and symptoms of mental and emotional distress, in self and others, that may
require assistance from adults. [HE; SE]

E3C93A978BE44456A0412C36FB52C51E.description:
Advocate for oneself by creating ‘I’-messages to express feelings and needs in appropriate
ways. [HPE; SE]

4C901C6758984D33A03E4F651CC81B51.description:
Apply refusal or negotiation skills in ways that support or improve mental health and minimize
health risks. [HPE; SE]

5DF30BC9E0944F72A12181E5ED252EDD.description:
Analyze how people from diverse groups can learn from each other and how this can enhance
emotional well-being. [HPE; SE]

294DB69D05444216A35CDA20C6DA71C0.description:
Accurately recognize and effectively respond to emotions, thoughts, values, and perspectives
when communicating with others and when resolving interpersonal conflicts. [HPE; SE]

2F46155E46124B05AC5C1B9049BEE107.description:
Identify how emotions can influence communication (e.g., anger or anxiety may affect the
ability to listen well) and demonstrate strategies (e.g., ask for time to calm down, go to a peace
corner, take deep breaths) to communicate effectively when experiencing a range of emotions
and in a variety of situations. [HPE; SE]

C47B1A7203444591A443C98329EE1FBB.description:
Discuss how adverse childhood experiences and toxic stress as well as resilience and positive
childhood experiences can impact mental and emotional health and demonstrate ways to
communicate effectively about these factors and ways to support people who have experienced
or are experiencing trauma. [HE; SE]

085F4BC63D934306A79BAAEAE3798C68.description:
Compare and contrast bullying, harassment, and abuse and demonstrate ways to support and
seek help for someone who is being bullied, harassed, or abused, or who is the target of
unhealthy or coercive behaviors. [HPE; SE]

B5D511100B1F41B7A9EB4DAB0B36D51D.description:
Demonstrate positive ways to communicate differences of opinion in a variety of relationships
(e.g., familial, peer, teacher) and situations (e.g., in class, outside of school, on a team). [HPE; SE]

5E635F16D34645599287B8C995A9EEF4.description:
Apply conflict resolution strategies in a variety of situations (e.g., interpersonal, intrapersonal,
intragroup, intergroup). [HPE; SE]

5CE873FAD2E441FABF290F24C1D14C11.description:
Analyze ways that prejudice, discrimination (e.g., sexism), and injustice can impact relationship
health and describe ways to address these issues to support health of self and others. [HPE; SE]

8E27340526554649AD63F2AEE36E316D.description:
Describe potential impacts of power and privilege (e.g., associated with age, race, ethnicity,
sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, socioeconomic status, immigration status, ability,
position of authority) within a variety of relationships and in various settings. [HPE; SE]

C17ADCC90DAD43CE97C66AEA207A26CD.description:
Analyze the impact of technology and social media on relationships (e.g., use of smartphones,
sharing relationship information, GPS tracking). [HE; SE]

439D990A6D214F2EB84958CF4DD925F5.description:
Analyze how media and technology can be both a positive and negative influence on beliefs
about what constitutes a healthy relationship (including sexual relationships). [HE; SE]

A06738B5DA8A4BDC8300404FC561CC2B.description:
Demonstrate techniques and assertive responses to counter coercive tactics in order to
maintain boundaries. [HE; SE]

E5BE6A689C91417FA64633BEE1789221.description:
Recognizing when boundaries are being violated and identify tactics used to coerce or pressure
someone to change a personal boundary (e.g., to have sex, to share a password, to send an
explicit photo, break a rule). [HE; SE]

5AD658F8F95241309FBFC8B733606169.description:
Demonstrate effective approaches to boundary setting (e.g., acknowledge feelings,
communicate the boundary, target alternative), maintenance of a variety of boundaries (e.g.,
related to technology use, emotional, physical). [HPE; SE]

3FBF0CF72CC045A0A9A2EF6ED3D3BE1E.description: Explain why consent and respecting a person’s boundaries are important. [HPE; SE]

A50DCE44E3284A0FBADA8CF4456479AA.description:
Articulate how respectful behaviors may vary among populations and how those behaviors
contribute to positive social interaction in various settings [HPE; SE].

611C1AD25C7A4A719B6DAD7129653B4E.description:
Demonstrate effective verbal and non-verbal communication skills (e.g., listening, conflict
resolution, negotiation, refusal) that foster healthy relationships, communicate boundaries, and
show respect in a variety of situations (e.g., familial relationships, peer relationships, romantic
relationships). [HPE; SE]

3EF0EAA475C6403E92115C922996759E.description:
Identify characteristics of healthy and unhealthy relationships and ways to seek help in
unhealthy or unwanted relationships. [HE; SE]

D2387842392F4D30AA0AB5D26BD4372C.description:
Social Awareness, Relationship, and Communication
Skills.
Enhance relationships, personal health, and the health of others through social
awareness and effective communication.

FC1BDD9018DF4A269898BB79C2AD82E4.description:
Describe how sexual health values and priorities may change over time, with varying
responsibilities and maturity. [HE]

78AB1F594BEC459185B48FEDD0BABCEC.description:
Examine reasons and considerations (e.g., cultural and societal norms, personal values and
beliefs) for determining emotional readiness for sexual behaviors. [HE]

9D14DF7AF53349879377488A75FF3A14.description:
Determine strategies that will reduce the risk of HIV and sexually transmitted infections
(STIs) and early pregnancy. [HE]

EF9DF6FC7EB143CBA2D12F4B0A46B732.description:
Assess personal health practices and develop short- and long-term goals that support
healthy sexual behaviors (e.g., abstinence, delay, use of contraception, use of barriers, giving
and obtaining consent). [HE]

AEA85543005546B6A774C3B9BC8E9AEE.description:
Apply knowledge of aerobic, strength and endurance, and flexibility training exercises
through the design and implementation of a short- and long-term health-related fitness
program (that includes a warm-up and cool down, addresses all components and principles
of fitness) that builds on strengths and addresses areas for improvement in fitness level. [PE]

8D9DAF904C92430FA56506B89E9858AF.description:
Apply movement concepts to different types of dances, gymnastics, rhythms, and individual
performance activities. [PE]

5F671A302796471FB2E5CDFB66E6B7AE.description:
Apply knowledge of personal health practices in order to self-select meaningful physical
activities. [PE]

F47B94AA8F42483EABA4A13D0C9E530C.description:
Explain connections between fitness and physical activity level and overall physical,
emotional, and mental health. [HPE]

DBDB224A024348479933887012234242.description:
Compare and contrast health-related and skill-related fitness components (i.e., strength,
muscular endurance, cardiovascular endurance, flexibility, balance, speed, balance, agility)
and principles (i.e., overload, specificity, progression, FITT – frequency, intensity, time,
type). [HPE]

3DCA37B67E884AB2B959BB17B8931C13.description:
Discuss various strategies for monitoring workout intensity (e.g., heart rate monitors, rate of
perceived exertion [RPE] scale) and describe strategies for adjusting workouts based on
results from monitoring to meet goals or targets. [PE]

319384ACE50A4CD68B9CC76FB3CAD9FC.description:
Apply dynamic and static stretching to exercise in warm-up, cool down, flexibility,
endurance, and physical activities. [PE]

62604A41DE334FBAB048570971A420E6.description:
Demonstrate the ability to follow game rules in a variety of physical activity situations and
applies and respects the importance of etiquette. [PE]

827F223F7F9A48F18807E69F350848D1.description:
Recognize and implement safe and appropriate behaviors during physical activity and with
exercise equipment. [PE]

00AE8F4F2E9D4A6C8D123D55BE7EBD3A.description:
Describe how self-expression and enjoyment impacts individual engagement in physical
activity. [PE; SE]

05A73825842445A095E8F091CC62F89D.description:
Analyze areas of strength related to physical activity, fitness and movement skills, identify
areas for improvement and demonstrates practice for individual improvement. [PE]

4DC75812797F40929527339B7EE01BF5.description: Analyze and demonstrate strategies for planning, prioritizing, and managing time. [HPE; SE]

797EDDAFE2AE4EF299D2DC84935B430A.description:
Create and monitor personal goals to meet identified emotional and mental health needs or
wants and identify people or resources to assist in meeting those goals. [HPE; SE]

154EF07EF9E5443C92003A3E1F2DBD6B.description: Demonstrate strategies to persevere when facing adversity. [HPE; SE]

1029DA5309B34C378B6A175E6C7E20ED.description: Apply health-promoting coping and stress management strategies. [HPE; SE]

30A9D10042414842AB9DFA4E13829D5B.description: Examine how various coping strategies may help or harm health. [HPE; SE]

464FD14F106C4C769FE92BF55EF0EBE3.description: Explain possible outcomes of expressing or repressing emotions. [HPE; SE]

56D3C5CC4CEA40DE858CC86295AD5AB6.description:
Demonstrate behaviors that will maintain or improve the mental and emotional well-being
of self and others. [HPE; SE]

FA0900665E424906981854C3011E177A.description:
Demonstrate techniques to independently manage emotions in a variety of settings. [HPE;
SE]

F09A06426EAF458B802A086B35F1D6E1.description:
Describe how emotions can impact one’s behaviors and experiences and how this might vary
in differing contexts. [HPE; SE]

C91D88FF4DF54D1C8572037F7F5EDEDD.description:
Describe and demonstrate strategies to effectively manage changing emotions during
adolescence. [HPE; SE]

E26A556D9DC649D5B3F8A2F86F495BCA.description:
Explain the role of individual and collective responsibility for maintaining and enhancing
mental and emotional well-being and describe environmental and contextual factors that
affect mental and emotional health and well-being. [HPE; SE]

EEBE76D39E82444295AA3AFFBE464C1E.description:
Self-management and Goal Setting.
Set goals, engage in health-promoting behaviors, and avoid risky behaviors.

7069E38CCF544E6EBFCB3292A09DEDA7.description:
Develop positive norms regarding substance use (e.g., most people (including teens) do not use
illegal drugs, most teens do not use nicotine or regularly consume alcohol, and most teens
refrain from even trying marijuana). [HE]

C5FFE628E66240A691515EDCCB97C3B7.description:
Analyze the potential negative effects of legal and illegal drug use on personal safety, physical
activity, relationships with friends and families, school success, brain development, and
attainment of present and future goals. [HPE]

8BDF71624E84422F8BF315DC4B7DC388.description:
Analyze factors (e.g., personal beliefs, source of substance, purpose of use) that may affect a
decision to use of legal or illegal substances. [HE]

D7BFCB2225C2418EB6F4E7B97019E58F.description:
Access valid and reliable information (from home, school, and community) about legal and
illegal drugs (in regard to age of legal use or type of substance) and use it to understand and
communicate the risks and dangers of drug use and misuse. [HE]

A3DC2C7AF9CD4154B6ADFE16CCCF1F26.description:
Identify circumstances that enable or encourage the use and misuse of legal and illegal drugs (in
regard to age of legal use or type of substance), determine when situations or problems related
to illegal drugs might require assistance, and identify possible options in how to respond. [HE]

193EBECCB95A45C096A34A83577FC192.description:
Thoughtfully apply a decision-making process in situations or to problems related to legal (e.g.,
prescription drugs prescribed to you, over-the-counter drugs, [at a certain age] nicotine,
electronic vapor products, alcohol, and marijuana) and illegal drug (e.g., prescription drugs not
prescribed to you, cocaine) use. [HE]

C6D8256E704A4FDA9563D03EBEA61D67.description:
Describe strategies that can be used to make decisions that adhere to personal values, beliefs,
and limits. [HE]

EBEB5A43F44A44CF9364BA12F9BF9BBD.description:
Explain the importance of, and ways to identify, setting personal limits to avoid unintended
outcomes from risky or unwanted sexual behavior and to make sexual health decisions. [HE]

6823579F707642118F1D6ACCCC88D255.description:
Analyze personal beliefs (including level of readiness) and values related to sexual activity and
sexual health. [HE]

223A2EF380624024BD23C9B4FC12FA81.description:
Articulate the benefits of postponing sexual activity and setting personal limits, including to
avoid early or unintended pregnancy and to reduce the risk of sexually transmitted infections,
based on personal beliefs and values. [HE]

BA7E4D5C0F7D4923BA59189C1524F21D.description:
Describe possible short- and long-term consequences (positive and negative) of engaging in
sexual activity and identify ways to avoid negative or potentially harmful consequences. [HE]

3957BE6F70264854A3B3D1A06FEE03D1.description:
Analyze ways to prevent pregnancy and sexually transmitted infections (STIs), including methods
that can be taken before becoming sexually active (e.g., communicating with a partner, HPV
vaccine, contraception). [HE]

9161EC70CB7D41D0A007A40CF0D91F7B.description:
Identify valid and reliable sources of information and resources to inform and support sexual
health choices. [HE]

79C352835BD94A92AF861485C65D746A.description: Apply an effective decision-making process in situations related to sexual health. [HE]

E4E69239FE47454284575F575CA92863.description:
Seek strategies for minimizing barriers and maximizing facilitators (e.g., time, space, physical
abilities, access to equipment, overuse of digital devices) that help maintain a physically active
lifestyle. [PE]

56ED34EDAF274E699EF4F47DAE4138EA.description:
Implement effective offensive and defensive strategies (i.e., creating open space, reducing
space, shot selection, reduce offensive options for opponents using tactics and shots, select and
apply appropriate shot and technique, defensive ready position) during game play for a variety
of games (including net/wall games, target games, invasion games, fielding and striking games,
etc.). [PE]

0190CE58FBB944D887A90661CDDF6ED8.description:
Apply strategies for overcoming individual or group challenges or problems in a physical activity
setting. [PE; SE]

B9D135AE60AD454D8EEE50AE995C1118.description:
Effectively apply team building and problem-solving strategies, in varied contexts, during various
physical activities (e.g., outdoor adventure, cooperative games, team sports, net/wall
games). [PE; SE]

473E2C53832E4E01888A5BAC02DB3735.description:
Demonstrate the ability to use a decision-making process to thoughtfully and effectively
address personal safety in a variety of situations. [HPE]

C1BFDA8B184C4C7092325A137634B058.description:
Analyze barriers that may prevent someone from reporting unsafe situations and child
maltreatment to adults and identify strategies to overcome these barriers. [HE]

62230C7FC1AE4458A03B43D1677027C6.description:
Evaluate a variety of non-violent responses to address conflict and demonstrate the ability to
use these responses to act on health-related decisions. [HPE; SE]

6CE6A547721D46CB9C37A274876563FC.description:
Describe the characteristics of various forms of abuse (i.e., physical abuse, emotional abuse,
psychological abuse, financial abuse, sexual abuse and exploitation), provide examples of
how abuse is used to control an individual, and demonstrate strategies for getting help. [HE]

FF9744CAB1124523A754BB412634CBE7.description:
Demonstrate strategies for keeping oneself safe online and in digital spaces (including
situations that could lead to exploitation or trafficking, and online sexual harassment). [HE]

926E73A76881413CB95E795F51C7FF38.description:
Explain the potential consequences of requesting, sending, or digitally posting sexually
explicit pictures or messages (e.g., on social media sites, chat groups, e-mail, texting,
websites, phone and tablet applications, and other digital forms) and demonstrate the ability
to make health-promoting decisions related to safe and legal activity in online and digital
spaces. [HE]

A97B070A38314D7C88281EDEAB486613.description:
Demonstrate strategies for avoiding situations that may lead to human trafficking and
sexual exploitation and for getting help if concerned about self or others. [HE]

01727B8BB3904B44A2073D521282870C.description:
Define exploitation, human trafficking and sex trafficking, and describe strategies used for
and warning sign behaviors of exploitation and recruitment of youth. [HE]

CE921CDE40D74F71B13667B8CDAB5FCB.description:
Describe laws (e.g., age of consent laws, child abuse, including sexual abuse, and sexual
exploitation laws, parental notification laws) that relate to young people’s sexual health
and the rights of adolescents to maintain their own health, and how these might impact
decisions related to sexual health. [HE]

2C82FBDF49BE4A6594B38E5389425FCC.description:
Evaluate potential options and consequences for decisions related to personal safety in a
variety of situations (e.g., motor vehicle safety, physical injury, digital safety, threats of
violence, inappropriate touch, physical, emotional, and sexual abuse). [HPE]

3D609C5FA42F4F74A4B55536C6C06E20.description:
Discuss how systemic and other factors (e.g., home rules, school connectedness,
environment, available supports, available equipment, weather, gender-based violence,
racism, and discrimination) help or hinder an individual’s ability to remain safe in a variety
of situations. [HPE]

C5058CBB0E5445098DC09D50437408FD.description:
Describe the role of individual versus shared responsibility in staying safe in a variety of
situations (e.g., outdoor recreation, motor vehicle safety, digital safety, threats of
violence). [HPE]

00F5B7D9CD844E889D9380A7E896F2F2.description:
Demonstrate the ability to apply a decision-making process to decisions related to consent in a
variety of situations (e.g., friendships, familial, with an intimate partner, in a sexual relationship)
and to communicate and respond to consent or non-consent. [HE; SE]

32956929D02F41FBA5A333ADDA6A54D3.description:
Define consent and describe factors, including drugs and alcohol, that may influence one’s
capacity to request consent, and to give and receive consent, including sexual consent, in a
variety of situations. [HE; SE]

F62440887BD44906B4CE10F8EF30471C.description:
Evaluate options and strategies a person might use to end an unhealthy relationship, including
involving a trusted adult who can help. [HE; SE]

BAAF3B540F6C422E94E810B78645044B.description: Identify warning signs of potential danger in a relationship and strategies to get help. [HE; SE]

F12E383BDC474F0E8B8B7AB0AB1173F6.description:
Compare and contrast the continuum of relationship behaviors (including identifying healthier
and less healthy behaviors, and the potential impacts of power differences such as age, gender,
status or position within relationships) and how these impact health and well-being. [HE; SE]

463F300750F649DC80E28FE9D10B1869.description:
Analyze the similarities and differences between friendships, romantic relationships, and sexual
relationships and discuss various ways to show affection within different relationships (e.g.,
holding hands, hugging, kind words, acts of kindness, kissing, sexual behaviors). [HE; SE]

F148CA75CD5C4C538C5FC340A1B1C2CA.description:
Decision-making and Problem-Solving.
Make health-promoting, informed, responsible decisions, and solve problems, in a
variety of health-related situations.
